page.title: 12RECREATION IN HIGH WYCOMBE
page.content: The largest open spaces in Wycombe are{The Rye}and{Hughenden Park.}As early as 1300 the Rye was grazing ground. The artifical dyke seperates the Wye River from the woods of Keep Hill and Wycombe Abbey.{The Rye}and {Holywell Mead}cover 67 acres with excellent sports facilities including an open air swimming pool and {Kingsmead}covers 36 arces with rugby pitches.{Hughenden Park}consists of 64 acres of parkland through which a stream flows. November 1977 saw the opening of{ {Wycombe Sports Centre}with a 50 metre pool used often for competitive swimming, plus a teaching pool. It also includes indoor bowling, weight training and squash courts. Outside there is a floodlit area for football and tennis. The Sports Centre caters for virtually every age group.
